snippet: Monica Macías, a daughter of a former president of Equatorial Guinea, was brought up after her father’s death under the protection of the North Korean ruler Kim Il-sung.
abstract: Saturday Profile of Monica Macias, daughter of former Equatorial Guinea Pres Francisco Macias Nguema who was raised under protection of North Korean ruler Kim Il-sung; Macias, who describes living with two dictators in her memoir I Am Monica From Pyongyang, questions her father figures' morals in political sphere but defends them both in personal one.
lead_paragraph: Monica Macías, a daughter of a former president of Equatorial Guinea, was brought up after her father’s death under the protection of the North Korean ruler Kim Il-sung.

headline.main: Fond Recollections of Dictators, Colored Later by the Lessons of History
headline.print_headline: Fond Recollections of Dictators, Colored Later by the Lessons of History
